title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's hockey claims first Olympic gold since 1980, defeating Canada 2-1 in overtime.
Jack Hughes scores the winning goal for the U.S. in 3-on-3 overtime; Connor Hellebuyck stops 41 shots.
The victory marks the third Olympic gold for the U.S. men's hockey team, following wins in 1960 and 1980.

title: 5 takeaways from the Revolution’s season-opening defeat in Nashville
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The New England Revolution began 2026 with a 4-1 loss to Nashville SC at Geodis Park.
Key defenders were absent, leaving New England's backline vulnerable against Nashville's aggressive offense.
The Revolution struggled to create scoring opportunities, highlighting early challenges for coach Marko Mitrović.

title: New Commuter Rail fare gates at South Station break down again
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The new commuter rail fare gates at South Station have closed twice due to harsh winter conditions.
Wind and snow have caused shutdowns of the fare gates, impacting commuter convenience at South Station.
The MBTA invested $3.3 million in the gates, expecting reduced fare evasion and increased mTicket activations.

title: Watch: Jack Hughes delivers USA first Olympic gold medal in men’s hockey since 1980, team honors Johnny Gaudreau
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jack Hughes scored the game-winning goal in overtime, leading Team USA to a 2-1 victory over Canada for Olympic gold.
Team USA celebrated the late Johnny Gaudreau by skating with his jersey and including his children in the medal ceremony.
Bruins players Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman returned with gold, marking the first Olympic gold for active Bruins since 2014.

title: After homering in spring training debut, could Andruw Monasterio play big role for Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Andruw Monasterio hit a 368-foot home run in the Red Sox' Grapefruit League opener against Twins pitcher Justin Topa.
Monasterio impressed Red Sox manager Alex Cora with his athleticism and could become a key infielder in 2026.
Monasterio's versatility and improved performance against lefties may position him as the primary platoon infielder.

title: MSP arrests Maine man after he allegedly crashed truck twice while on drugs
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Andrew Beaulieu, 30, from Carthage, Maine, was charged with drug possession and impaired driving after two crashes.
The first crash occurred at a Burger King rest area on Route 24 South in Bridgewater, damaging the main entrance.
Police found substances believed to be synthetic cannabinoids in Beaulieu's truck after a second crash in Westport.

title: Methuen woman searching for her wedding dress after dry cleaner mix-up
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Kathleen Shea Dunleavy of Methuen discovered she had a wedding dress mix-up after opening a preservation box.
After reuniting a New Hampshire bride with her dress, Dunleavy seeks her own gown lost 15 years ago.
The missing gown features buttons down the back, a flower appliqué, and initials 'KS' embroidered in blue.

title: At Chevalier Theatre, Mavis Staples lives up to her legacy of joy and protest
author: Terence Cawley
bullets: Mavis Staples delivered a 12-song, 65-minute performance at Chevalier Theatre in Medford, focusing on joy and social issues.
Staples balanced classic songs with contemporary covers and political themes, receiving strong reactions to songs like 'Freedom Highway'.
Northampton native Kimaya Diggs opened the show with R&B tunes that appealed to both contemporary and old-school fans.

title: Here’s how the Red Sox plan on handling MLB’s new ABS challenging system
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Red Sox players can now challenge balls and strikes using the new ABS system starting in 2026.
Wilson Contreras was the first Red Sox to successfully challenge a strike call during spring training.
Each MLB team will get two ABS challenges per game, retaining them if the challenge is successful.

title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito remains unsigned in free agency after opting out from the Red Sox despite a strong 2025 season.
Red Sox pitcher Garrett Crochet expresses surprise at Giolito's free agency status, noting his impressive 2025 performance.
With new additions Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, Giolito is unlikely to return to Boston's now-strong rotation.
